intro: Pabstiella fusca, commonly known as the dark-stemmed pabstiella, is a rare and lesser-known species of flowering plant. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it grows in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
